2012-02-29.snippet: The delay means a decision to increase the bailout fund is not likely to come until late March, and illustrates how hard it has been to reconcile impatient financial markets with democratic processes....
2012-02-29.lead_paragraph: The delay means a decision to increase the bailout fund is not likely to come until late March, and illustrates how hard it has been to reconcile impatient financial markets with democratic processes.
2012-02-29.abstract: European Union officials postpone a crucial meeting on resolving the debt crisis in the face of domestic politics, highlighting difficulties that have risen in trying to reconcile financial markets with democratic processes.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt, Stephen Castle from Brussels and Melissa Eddy from Berlin. Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Spain.

2012-02-29.snippet: February has been a good month for the Dow Jones industrial average, as it has traded at levels not seen since the 2008 financial crisis....
2012-02-29.lead_paragraph: February has been a good month for the Dow Jones industrial average, as it has traded at levels not seen since the 2008 financial crisis.
2012-02-29.abstract: Dow Jones industrial average closes above 13,000 for the first time since 2008, capping off a strong February; the index last closed above 13,000 on May 19, 2008, when it ended trading at 13,028.16; a final surge sent it over the top to finish at 13,005.12 at the close, just 0.18 percent higher.

headline.seo: Dow Closes Above 13,000; First Time Since 2008
headline.main: Dow Closes Above 13,000; First Time Since 2008
headline.print_headline: Dow in First 13,000 Close Since 2008

2012-02-29.snippet: The spike in the Conference Board’s monthly gauge of economic confidence to 70.8 could mean consumers will spend more readily, analysts said....
2012-02-29.lead_paragraph: The spike in the Conference Board’s monthly gauge of economic confidence to 70.8 could mean consumers will spend more readily, analysts said.
2012-02-29.abstract: Strengthening jobs market helps lift consumer confidence to a one-year high, but surprisingly large decline in orders for some factory goods casts doubt on economic momentum; spike in the Conference Board's monthly gauge of economic confidence, which rose more than expected to 70.8, could be a sign that consumers are more willing to spend in the coming months.

headline.seo: Jobs Lift Consumer Confidence, but Factory Orders Fall
headline.main: Consumer Confidence Turns Up
headline.print_headline: Consumer Confidence Turns Up

2012-02-29.snippet: Although Greek bonds can no longer be used as collateral with the European Central Bank, national central banks can step in under a stop-gap measure....
2012-02-29.lead_paragraph: Although Greek bonds can no longer be used as collateral with the European Central Bank, national central banks can step in under a stop-gap measure.
2012-02-29.abstract: European Central Bank acts to prevent a potential collapse of the Greek banking system after Standard & Poor's declares the country to be in 'selective default,' making Greek bonds ineligible as collateral for loans; S&P issued the most recent downgrade following the debt-reduction deal reached with Greece's private sector creditors; European Central Bank says banks could continue to draw cash from national central banks temporarily under a separate program known as emergency liquidity assistance.

headline.seo: Support Is Offered to Greek Banks After Latest Downgrade
headline.main: Support Is Offered to Greek Banks After Latest Downgrade
headline.print_headline: Support for Greek Banks After Downgrade
